author: Special Correspondent
text:
: Special ‘pujai’ will be performed at Sri Anjaneyaswamy temples in various parts of the city on the occasion of Hanuman Jayanthi on January 9.

At Sri Anjaneya Temple in Kallukuzhi, one lakh and eight ‘vadai maalai’ and an equal number of ‘jaangiri maalai’ will be adorned to the presiding deity. A laksharchanai will be performed. R. Kasturirajan, co-ordinator, said special arrangements would be made for regulating the queue. K. Anandkumar Rao, Executive Officer, said that the ‘jaangiri’ and ‘vadai’ would be distributed to devotees at the end of the ‘deeparadanai’.

Music concerts, special homam and special parayanam will be performed for seven days from January 5 to 11 at Sri Sanjeevana Anjaneyar temple on South Chithra Street in Srirangam.

While the homam and other religious rituals will be performed in the morning, the music concerts will be held in the evening, according to R. Vasudevan, founder of the Sri Sanjeevana Anjaneyar Trust.

On January 9, 108 kalasa pujai and special tirumanjanam will be performed in the morning. Special alankaram will be performed in the afternoon, he added.
title: Special puja for Sri Hanuman Jayanthi
